item.description: 「中国・反日デモ暴徒化の背景と、日中関係の今後～～最も基礎から解説！」西端真矢 http://t.co/m3RkdHKd
item.content:encoded: 「中国・反日デモ暴徒化の背景と、日中関係の今後～～最も基礎から解説！」西端真矢　http://t.co/m3RkdHKd 2012年 / 9月 / 8月 / 7月 / 6月 / 5月 / 4月 / 3月 / 2月 / 1月 / 2011年 / 12月 / 11月 / 10月 / 9月 / 8月 / 7月 / 6月 / 5月 / 4月 / 3月 / 2月 / 1月 / 2010年 / 12月 / 11月 / 10月 / 9月 / 8月 / 7月 / 6月 / 5月 / 4月 / 3月 / 中国・反日デモ暴徒化の背景と、日中関係の今後～～最も基礎から解説！ (2012/09/18 ) 晩夏の夜、夏の着物で最後のお出かけ (2012/09/10 ) 偽おはしょりの作り方！ (2012/09/01 ) おばあちゃんの世界 (2012/08/21 ) ちょっと珍しい柄の手ぬぐい入手！＋草の根の被災地支援 (2012/08/15 ) 四国・保多織りの浴衣で、友人の書を見る (2012/08/09 ) 我が家の猫はちょっと性格が悪い？ (2012/08/07 ) 昼顔の絽のお着物で、浅草散歩 (2012/08/01 ) 珍しい、蝶の文様の浴衣でお出かけ (2012/07/26 ) 福島直後の東京をつづった散文詩、香港のアート雑誌に掲載 (2012/07/24 ) Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: maya-fwe.com

item.title: When 'Mother Jones' Opposed 'Selectively Edited' Video 'Reported Uncritically By the Media'
item.description: When 'Mother Jones' Opposed 'Selectively Edited' Video 'Reported Uncritically By the Media' -- http://t.co/VHrWjXwM
item.content:encoded: When 'Mother Jones' Opposed 'Selectively Edited' Video 'Reported Uncritically By the Media' -- http://t.co/VHrWjXwM To be frank, I don’t believe David Corn or "Mother Jones." I think the missing minutes are mitigating and might even show Romney in a good light; might even show him clarifying his remarks. There's a reason Corn and "Mother Jones" tried to get away with passing off the edited video as unedited, and this is the only reason that makes any sense. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: breitbart.com

item.content:encoded: NBC/WSJ poll: Obama leads Romney by 5 points among likely voters, has 50% job approval rating for 1st time since March. http://t.co/nFPM71sT Fueled by increased optimism about the economy and nation’s direction, President Barack Obama leads Mitt Romney by 5 points among likely voters and now sees his job-approval rating reaching the 50 percent threshold for the first time since March, according to a new NBC New … Link - Trackbacks

item.title: 'There Are Not A Lot Of People Out There Who Think They Are Victims'
item.description: Obama offers first public response to Romney's "47 percent" remarks http://t.co/vkspoa75
item.content:encoded: Obama offers first public response to Romney's "47 percent" remarks http://t.co/vkspoa75 NEW YORK — Rebuking Mitt Romney, President Barack Obama said Tuesday that Americans are not "victims" and that voters want to make sure that their president is "not writing off big chunks of the country." Obama's remarks came after a secretly taped and newly released video showed the Republican presidential nominee describing "47 percent of the people" as Obama supporters who depend on government and believe they are victims. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

item.title: Obama Extends Lead In New Poll - WSJ.com
item.description: WSJ/NBC poll has O up by 5 among LV 50-45 http://t.co/R2fDrvp3
item.content:encoded: WSJ/NBC poll has O up by 5 among LV 50-45 http://t.co/R2fDrvp3 Buoyed by an upswing in economic optimism, President Barack Obama has strengthened his support among voters and is now rated as equal to Mitt Romney on which candidate can best improve the economy, a new Wall Street Journal/NBC News poll finds. Link - Trackbacks
